\paragraph{ScanArchive.py positional arguments}
\label{\detokenize{com:ScanArchive.py-positional-arguments}}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
{\hyperref[\detokenize{com:ScanArchive.py-all|net.stnm}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstylestrong{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{all|net.stnm}}}}}} \sphinxhyphen{} List of networks/stations to process given in {[}net{]}.{[}stnm{]} format or just {[}stnm{]} (separated by spaces; if {[}stnm{]} is not unique in the database, all stations with that name will be processed). Use keyword \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\textquotesingle{}all\textquotesingle{}}} to process all stations in the database. If {[}net{]}.all is given, all stations from network {[}net{]} will be processed. Three letter ISO 3166 international standard codes can be provided (always in upper case) to select all stations within a country. If a station name is given using a * in front (e.g. {\color{red}\bfseries{}*}igs.pwro or {\color{red}\bfseries{}*}pwro) then the station will be removed from the list. If {\color{red}\bfseries{}*}net.all or ISO country code was used (e.g. {\color{red}\bfseries{}*}igs.all or {\color{red}\bfseries{}*}ARG), then remove the stations within this group. Wildcards are accepted using the regex postgres convention. Use {[}{]} to provide character ranges (e.g. ars.at1{[}3\sphinxhyphen{}5{]} or ars.{[}a\sphinxhyphen{}b{]}x01). Char \%\% matches any string (e.g. ars.at\%\%). Char | represents the OR operator that can be used to select one string or another (e.g. ars.at1{[}1|2{]} to choose at11 and at12). To specify a wildcard using a single character, use \_ (equivalent to ? in POSIX regular expressions). Alternatively, a file with the station list can be provided (using all the same conventions described above). When using a file, * can be replaced with \sphinxhyphen{} for clarity in removing stations from .all lists (default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{None}})

\end{itemize}


\paragraph{ScanArchive.py options}
\label{\detokenize{com:ScanArchive.py-options}}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
{\hyperref[\detokenize{com:ScanArchive.py--h}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstylestrong{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}h}}}}}}, {\hyperref[\detokenize{com:ScanArchive.py---help}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstylestrong{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}\sphinxhyphen{}help}}}}}} \sphinxhyphen{} show this help message and exit

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
{\hyperref[\detokenize{com:ScanArchive.py--rinex}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstylestrong{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}rinex}}}}}} \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\{IGNORE\_STNLIST\}}}, {\hyperref[\detokenize{com:ScanArchive.py---rinex}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstylestrong{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}\sphinxhyphen{}rinex}}}}}} \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\{IGNORE\_STNLIST\}}} \sphinxhyphen{} Scan the current archive for RINEX 2/3 files and add them to the database if missing. Station list will be used to filter specific networks and stations if \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\{ignore\_stnlist\}}} = 0. For example: ScanArchive {[}net{]}.all \sphinxhyphen{}rinex 0 will process all the stations in network {[}net{]}, but networks and stations have to exist in the database. If ScanArchive {[}net{]}.all \sphinxhyphen{}rinex 1 the station list will be ignored and everything in the archive will be checked (and added to the db if missing) even if networks and stations don\textasciigrave{}\textasciigrave{}’t exist. Networks and stations will be added if they don’{\color{red}\bfseries{}\textasciigrave{}\textasciigrave{}}t exist. (default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{None}})

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
{\hyperref[\detokenize{com:ScanArchive.py--otl}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstylestrong{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}otl}}}}}}, {\hyperref[\detokenize{com:ScanArchive.py---ocean_loading}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstylestrong{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}\sphinxhyphen{}ocean\_loading}}}}}} \sphinxhyphen{} Calculate ocean loading coefficients using FES2004. To calculate FES2014b coefficients, use OTL\_FES2014b.py

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
{\hyperref[\detokenize{com:ScanArchive.py--stninfo}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstylestrong{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}stninfo}}}}}} \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ARGUMENT}}, {\hyperref[\detokenize{com:ScanArchive.py---station_info}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstylestrong{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}\sphinxhyphen{}station\_info}}}}}} \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ARGUMENT}} \sphinxhyphen{} Insert station information to the database. If no arguments are given, then scan the archive for station info files and use their location (folder) to determine the network to use during insertion. Only stations in the station list will be processed. If a filename is provided, then scan that file only, in which case a second argument specifies the network to use during insertion. Eg: \sphinxhyphen{}stninfo \textasciitilde{}/station.info arg. In cases where multiple networks are being processed, the network argument will be used to desambiguate station code conflicts. Eg: ScanArchive all \sphinxhyphen{}stninfo \textasciitilde{}/station.info arg \sphinxhyphen{}\textgreater{} if a station named igm1 exists in networks \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\textquotesingle{}igs\textquotesingle{}}} and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\textquotesingle{}arg\textquotesingle{}}}, only \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\textquotesingle{}arg.igm1\textquotesingle{}}} will get the station information insert. Use keyword \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\textquotesingle{}stdin\textquotesingle{}}} to read the station information data from the pipeline. (default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{None}})

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
{\hyperref[\detokenize{com:ScanArchive.py--export}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstylestrong{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}export}}}}}} \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{{[}DATALESS SEED{]}}}, {\hyperref[\detokenize{com:ScanArchive.py---export_station}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstylestrong{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}\sphinxhyphen{}export\_station}}}}}} \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{{[}DATALESS SEED{]}}} \sphinxhyphen{} Export a station from the local database that can be imported into another Parallel.GAMIT system using the \sphinxhyphen{}import option.One file is created per station in the current directory. If the {[}dataless seed{]} switch is passed (e.g. \sphinxhyphen{}export true), then the export seed is created without data (only metadata included, i.e. station info, station record, etc). (default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{None}})

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
{\hyperref[\detokenize{com:ScanArchive.py--import}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstylestrong{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}import}}}}}} \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\{DEFAULT NET\}}}, {\hyperref[\detokenize{com:ScanArchive.py---import_station}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstylestrong{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}\sphinxhyphen{}import\_station}}}}}} \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\{DEFAULT NET\}}} \sphinxhyphen{} Import a station from zipfiles produced by another Parallel.GAMIT system. Wildcards are accepted to import multiple zipfiles. If station does not exist, use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\{default net\}}} to specify the network where station should be added to. If \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\{default net\}}} does not exit, it will be created. Station list is ignored. (default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{None}})

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
{\hyperref[\detokenize{com:ScanArchive.py--get}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstylestrong{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}get}}}}}} \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\{DATE\}}}, {\hyperref[\detokenize{com:ScanArchive.py---get_from_archive}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstylestrong{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}\sphinxhyphen{}get\_from\_archive}}}}}} \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\{DATE\}}} \sphinxhyphen{} Get the specified station from the archive and copy it to the current directory. Fix it to match the station information in the database. (default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{None}})

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
{\hyperref[\detokenize{com:ScanArchive.py--ppp}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstylestrong{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}ppp}}}}}} \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ARGUMENT}}, {\hyperref[\detokenize{com:ScanArchive.py---ppp}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstylestrong{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}\sphinxhyphen{}ppp}}}}}} \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ARGUMENT}} \sphinxhyphen{} Run ppp on the rinex files in the database. Append {[}date\_start{]} and (optionally) {[}date\_end{]} to limit the range of the processing. Allowed formats are yyyy\_doy, wwww\sphinxhyphen{}d, fyear or yyyy/mm/dd. Append keyword \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\textquotesingle{}hash\textquotesingle{}}} to the end to check the PPP hash values against the station information records. If hash doesn’t match, recalculate the PPP solutions. (default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{None}})

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
{\hyperref[\detokenize{com:ScanArchive.py--rehash}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstylestrong{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}rehash}}}}}} \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ARGUMENT}}, {\hyperref[\detokenize{com:ScanArchive.py---rehash}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstylestrong{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}\sphinxhyphen{}rehash}}}}}} \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ARGUMENT}} \sphinxhyphen{} Check PPP hash against station information hash. Rehash PPP solutions to match the station information hash without recalculating the PPP solution. Optionally append {[}date\_start{]} and (optionally) {[}date\_end{]} to limit the rehashing time window. Allowed formats are yyyy.doy or yyyy/mm/dd. (default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{None}})

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
{\hyperref[\detokenize{com:TrajectoryFit.py--force_stn}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstylestrong{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}force\_stn}}}}}} \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\{STATION LIST\}}}, {\hyperref[\detokenize{com:TrajectoryFit.py---force_stations}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstylestrong{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}\sphinxhyphen{}force\_stations}}}}}} \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\{STATION LIST\}}} \sphinxhyphen{} Force stations to be included in the selected field. Specify the list of networks/stations given in {[}net{]}.{[}stnm{]} format or just {[}stnm{]}. If {[}stnm{]} is not unique in the database, all stations with that name will be processed.Alternatively, a file with the station list can be provided. (default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{{[}{]}}})

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
{\hyperref[\detokenize{com:TrajectoryFit.py--lat_lim}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstylestrong{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}lat\_lim}}}}}} \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\{MIN\_LAT MAX\_LAT\}}}, {\hyperref[\detokenize{com:TrajectoryFit.py---latitude_limits}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstylestrong{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}\sphinxhyphen{}latitude\_limits}}}}}} \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\{MIN\_LAT MAX\_LAT\}}} \sphinxhyphen{} Latitude limits (decimal degrees, stations discarded outside of this limit) provided as south, north limit. Default is \sphinxhyphen{}90 90 (default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{{[}\sphinxhyphen{}90, 90{]}}})

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
{\hyperref[\detokenize{com:TrajectoryFit.py--sigma}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstylestrong{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}sigma}}}}}} \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\{MM\}}}, {\hyperref[\detokenize{com:TrajectoryFit.py---sigma_cutoff}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstylestrong{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}\sphinxhyphen{}sigma\_cutoff}}}}}} \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\{MM\}}} \sphinxhyphen{} Reject stations based on the ETM’s wrms (in mm). This filter is not applied for the forced station list. (default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{{[}2.5{]}}})

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
{\hyperref[\detokenize{com:TrajectoryFit.py--vel}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstylestrong{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}vel}}}}}} \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\{MM/YR\}}}, {\hyperref[\detokenize{com:TrajectoryFit.py---velocity_cutoff}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstylestrong{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}\sphinxhyphen{}velocity\_cutoff}}}}}} \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\{MM/YR\}}} \sphinxhyphen{} ETM velocity cutoff value to reject stations for velocity interpolation (norm of NE in mm/yr). (default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{{[}50{]}}})

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
{\hyperref[\detokenize{com:TrajectoryFit.py--interseismic}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstylestrong{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}interseismic}}}}}} \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{{[}VELOCITY\_CUTOFF{]} {[}OUTPUT\_FILENAME{]} {[}KMZ\_FILENAME{]}}}, {\hyperref[\detokenize{com:TrajectoryFit.py---interseismic_process}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstylestrong{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}\sphinxhyphen{}interseismic\_process}}}}}} \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{{[}VELOCITY\_CUTOFF{]} {[}OUTPUT\_FILENAME{]} {[}KMZ\_FILENAME{]}}} \sphinxhyphen{} Process stations for interseismic velocity field computation. Reject stations with interseismic velocity \textgreater{} \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\{velocity\_cutoff\}}} (default 50 mm/yr). Filename to output the selected stations (default filename interseismic.txt). Optionally, specify a kmz filename to output the selected and rejected stations with their velocity components and ETMs embedded in the kmz (default no kmz).

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
{\hyperref[\detokenize{com:TrajectoryFit.py--postseismic}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstylestrong{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}postseismic}}}}}} \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\{INTERSEISMIC\_GRID\} \{EVENT\_DATE\} \{OUTPUT\_FILENAME\} \{KMZ\_FILENAME\} {[}EVENT\_DATE\_1{]} {[}EVENT\_DATE\_2{]} ... {[}EVENT\_GRID\_1{]} {[}EVENT\_GRID\_2{]} ...}}, {\hyperref[\detokenize{com:TrajectoryFit.py---postseismic_process}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstylestrong{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}\sphinxhyphen{}postseismic\_process}}}}}} \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\{INTERSEISMIC\_GRID\} \{EVENT\_DATE\} \{OUTPUT\_FILENAME\} \{KMZ\_FILENAME\} {[}EVENT\_DATE\_1{]} {[}EVENT\_DATE\_2{]} ... {[}EVENT\_GRID\_1{]} {[}EVENT\_GRID\_2{]} ...}} \sphinxhyphen{} Process stations for postseismic field computation. Interseismic removal is done using \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\{interseismic\_grid\}}}. The event parameters to be extracted from the ETMs correspond to seismic event given in \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\{event\_date\}}}. Resulting parameters will be written to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\{output\_filename\}}}. Additionally, provide {[}event\_date\_n{]} and {[}event\_grid\_n{]} if a previous postsiesmic processes should be removed from the ETMs. If no {[}event\_date\_n{]} are given, then any previous events are ignored (but they could still be present in the ETM fit). (default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{None}})

\end{itemize}

\paragraph{GenerateKml.py options}
\label{\detokenize{parallel_gamit:GenerateKml.py-options}}\begin{itemize}
\item {}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar

Default returns all stations. Network and station codes allow using wildcards. (default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{{[}{]}}})

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
{\hyperref[\detokenize{parallel_gamit:GenerateKml.py--stninfo}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstylestrong{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}stninfo}}}}}}, {\hyperref[\detokenize{parallel_gamit:GenerateKml.py---station_info}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstylestrong{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}\sphinxhyphen{}station\_info}}}}}} \sphinxhyphen{} Run integrity checks on station information and output results to kmz file. The icons of the stations will represent any problems in the station info records.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar

Default uses production/\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\{project\_name\}}} where \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\{project\_name\}}} is the project name declared in the PG cfg file. (default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{None}})

\item {}

\subsubsection{WeeklyCombination.py \sphinxhyphen{} CLI interface}
\label{\detokenize{parallel_gamit:WeeklyCombination.py---CLI-interface}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Program to perform weekly loosely\sphinxhyphen{}constrained solutions. Combination is performed using GLOBK. Result is output in SINEX format.

                     \PYG{n+nb}{all}\PYG{o}{|}\PYG{n}{net}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{stnm} \PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n+nb}{all}\PYG{o}{|}\PYG{n}{net}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{stnm} \PYG{o}{.}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{p}{]}

\paragraph{pyParallelGamit.py options}
\label{\detokenize{parallel_gamit:pyParallelGamit.py-options}}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
{\hyperref[\detokenize{parallel_gamit:pyParallelGamit.py--h}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstylestrong{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}h}}}}}}, {\hyperref[\detokenize{parallel_gamit:pyParallelGamit.py---help}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstylestrong{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}\sphinxhyphen{}help}}}}}} \sphinxhyphen{} show this help message and exit

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
{\hyperref[\detokenize{parallel_gamit:pyParallelGamit.py--d}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstylestrong{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}d}}}}}} \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\{DATE\}}}, {\hyperref[\detokenize{parallel_gamit:pyParallelGamit.py---date}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstylestrong{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}\sphinxhyphen{}date}}}}}} \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\{DATE\}}} \sphinxhyphen{} Date range to process. Can be specified in yyyy/mm/dd yyyy\_doy wwww\sphinxhyphen{}d format (default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{None}})

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
{\hyperref[\detokenize{parallel_gamit:pyParallelGamit.py--dp}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstylestrong{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}dp}}}}}} \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\{YEAR\} \{DOYS\}}}, {\hyperref[\detokenize{parallel_gamit:pyParallelGamit.py---date_parser}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstylestrong{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}\sphinxhyphen{}date\_parser}}}}}} \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\{YEAR\} \{DOYS\}}} \sphinxhyphen{} Parse date using ranges and commas (e.g. 2018 1,3\sphinxhyphen{}6). Cannot cross year boundaries (default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{None}})

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
{\hyperref[\detokenize{parallel_gamit:pyParallelGamit.py--e}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstylestrong{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}e}}}}}} \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\{STATION\}}}, {\hyperref[\detokenize{parallel_gamit:pyParallelGamit.py---exclude}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstylestrong{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}\sphinxhyphen{}exclude}}}}}} \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\{STATION\}}} \sphinxhyphen{} List of stations to exclude from this processing (e.g. \sphinxhyphen{}e igm1 lpgs vbca) (default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{None}})

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
{\hyperref[\detokenize{parallel_gamit:pyParallelGamit.py--c}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstylestrong{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}c}}}}}} \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\{STATION\}}}, {\hyperref[\detokenize{parallel_gamit:pyParallelGamit.py---check_mode}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstylestrong{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}\sphinxhyphen{}check\_mode}}}}}} \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\{STATION\}}} \sphinxhyphen{} Check station(s) mode. If station(s) are not present in the GAMIT polyhedron, (i.e. the RINEX file(s) were missing at the time of the processing) Parallel.GAMIT will add the station to the closest subnetwork(s) and reprocess them. If station(s) were present at the time of the processing but failed to process (i.e. they are in the missing stations list), these subnetworks will be reprocessed to try to obtain a solution. Station list provided in the cfg is ignored in this mode. Therefore, changes in the station list will not produce any changes in network configuration. Purge not allowed when using this mode. (Syntax: \sphinxhyphen{}c igm1 lpgs rms.vbca) (default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{None}})

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
{\hyperref[\detokenize{parallel_gamit:pyParallelGamit.py--i}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstylestrong{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}i}}}}}}, {\hyperref[\detokenize{parallel_gamit:pyParallelGamit.py---ignore_missing}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstylestrong{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}\sphinxhyphen{}ignore\_missing}}}}}} \sphinxhyphen{} When using check mode or processing existing sessions, ignore missing stations. In other words, do not try to reprocess sessions that have missing solutions.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar

\index{set\_axes\_equal() (in module parallel\_gamit.test\_voronoi)@\spxentry{set\_axes\_equal()}\spxextra{in module parallel\_gamit.test\_voronoi}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{parallel_gamit:parallel_gamit.test_voronoi.set_axes_equal}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{parallel\_gamit.test\_voronoi.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{set\_axes\_equal}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{ax}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Make axes of 3D plot have equal scale so that spheres appear as spheres,
cubes as cubes, etc..  This is one possible solution to Matplotlib’s
ax.set\_aspect(‘equal’) and ax.axis(‘equal’) not working for 3D.
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Input}
\sphinxAtStartPar
ax: a matplotlib axis, e.g., as output from plt.gca().

\end{description}

\end{fulllineitems}

These may br from a parent frame such as ITRF. Inheritance will occur with stations on the list whenever a parameter exists. Example: \sphinxhyphen{}constraints itrf14.txt Format is: net.stn x y z epoch vx vy vz sn\_1y sn\_6m cn\_1y cn\_6m se\_1y se\_6m ce\_1y ce\_6m su\_1y su\_6m cu\_1y cu\_6m (default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{None}})
